page.title: 05St. Peter's Church, Broome
page.content:
{St. Peter's Church}is a Church of England Church. It is a simple Italianate building of the 19th century. The interior span is 15 feet and the low oak benches each have a rose carved on every end. Each sunday there are three services (Holy Communion, Matins and Evensong). Once a month there is also a Family Service.
Since 1969, the Rector has been Mr Walter Iliffe. Mrs Woods and Miss Pheysey are the organists who take it in turn to play for the services. The Rector's warden is Mr R Davies and the People's Warden is Mr C Barnes. Broome Church Notes, giving details of services and events, is distributed by Mr W Pheysey.
